(2015) Damon & Naomi - Fortune



Review:
Just as Dean Wareham has remained busy since the breakup of Galaxie 500, so too have Naomi Yang and Damon Krukowski. Continuing on as Damon & Naomi, their latest album is called Fortune.
While the album is being released in traditional formats Ã¢â‚¬â€ Fortune is actually a soundtrack for YangÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s otherwise-silent film of the same name. An announcement explains, Ã¢â‚¬Å“The visuals are so bound up in the music (and vice-versa) that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s more of a long-form music video, a visual poem set to the metronome of a textural score.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
The piece was inspired by the recent passing of YangÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s father, a photographer who left behind a huge archive of work. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s also a tarot card theme, plus painted portraits from the Ã¢â‚¬â„¢40s and Ã¢â‚¬â„¢50s. Despite the importance of the visuals, however, the music is designed to stand alone.
This followÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s last yearÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Bootleg Edition of the 1995 album The Wondrous World of Damon & Naomi. Their most recent new studio album was 2011Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s False Beats and True Hearts.
Rating 7/10
